text: Guys to be very honest, if you are watching this movie believe me , worth it , amazing, this movie will take you in roller coaster rider because of quantum theory , this is the man ant man who will fill Tony's blank space.Guys to be very honest, if you are watching this movie believe me , worth it , amazing, this movie will take you in roller coaster rider because of quantum theory , this is the man ant man who will fill Tony's blank space.Guys to be very honest, if you are watching this movie believe me , worth it , amazing, this movie will take you in roller coaster rider because of quantum theory , this is the man ant man who will fill Tony's blank space.

title: A great movie with a few flaws
text: The movie itself was very fun and important to the marvel cinematic universe Paul rudd was fantastic as ant man and the movie balanced comedy and seriousness quite well.There were two things i thought could have been executed better.The first is Hank Pym, it really felt like they couldn't find an important storyline for him so most of the movie he was just there not really having a purpose building up to the end where he had a purpose that was clearly written for him to have a part in the story.The next thing was the fact the movie kept referring to the main vilian as "he" for half of the movie which was quite forced.Overall I think you should definitely watch this movie because it's still a very good movie and important if you are a marvel fan.

title: Powered Marvel Romp
text: Quantum Mania provides viewers with a humorous and action-packed Marvel adventure that maintains their interest throughout the film. The compelling narrative of the movie, when coupled with the film's impressive visual effects and outstanding performances, makes for an enjoyable viewing experience. Despite the fact that it might not be the most impressive installment in the series, there are a lot of exciting moments and funny jokes. The journey through the immersive quantum realm will be a treat for anyone who enjoys the characters. Hold on tight, because you're about to embark on an adventure that more than lives up to the legacy of Ant-Man and the Wasp.

title: Not that bad
text: I get why some critics weren't thrilled with this one. They might've expected Kang to be more intense and ruthless. But this movie's more about expanding the Marvel universe and letting Jonathan Majors show off as Kang. Still, the character's impact isn't all that remarkable.But hey, Ant-Man and The Wasp still matter. They bring the emotions and personal stuff that we can relate to. The movie's not perfect, but I'm here for the Marvel world getting bigger and the characters.And guess what? Bill Murray is now part of the MCU. I'm a fan. Hope to see his character's return, rather than ending up as octopus food.

title: CGI heavy but that's to be expected given the subject matter
text: First up, I'll say I seem to be in a minority that like this movie.Of course I have the advantage of remembering the characters and sort-of stories from the comics of my youth.The movie begins with a wonderful little sequence for Scott Lang.Paul Rudd is excellent in the role of Scott Lang throughout. He is ably supported by the regulars and Katheryn Newton does well taking over the reins as Cassie from Abby Ryder Fortson.On top of this the movie adds Kang the Conqueror as the antagonist. Superb performance by Jonathon Majors, who I first came across in "Lovecraft Country". Very good actor indeed.The cast is littered with other very notable performances but I'm going to pick out just one and that's Corey Stoll as M. O. D. O. K, or as Scott calls him M. O. D. O. F. K. Bringing Darren Cross in this twist from the comic cannon is well done. It's an excellent performance, especially given the intriguing way the character must have been filmed and produced.I guessed the main plot elements (see second paragraph above) but his didn't spoil the movie one little bit for me. It's constructed well enough.IMHO this is an excellent addition to the MCU, the humour is good and the plot and action lively.I'd happily recommend this movie.

title: Highly underrated
text: If you come to watch this Movie, you do it knowing well the Stories behind it and what's to come.With that in mind, it still manages to surprise by presenting a full Universe with unique characters and plots, mystery and awe. The action is there, the plot building and momentum works well, the animations are quite remarkable.It could have given more dialogs to all the characters but for a compacted 2 hours movie experience it delivers everything you would expect from such an adventure, and begining of phase five of the MCU.Also the two easter eggs in the credits are mindblowningly cool :)

title: Huh?
text: There is absolutely nothing political about this film, so why are some reviewers complaining that it is "too political?" Reviewers calling it "woke"-huh? They provide no examples of how this action film is "woke." Exactly. It's not. At all.This film is fine. Another in a long line of chum that will be fed to us from Disney for decades to come. My only real complaint is that Michael Douglas is too old for action movies and needs to stick with geriatric fare, like the Kazinsky Method.This movie on Disney+ which everyone already had a subscription to, so you watched it basically for free. Quit your complaining.

title: Perfect start of the Phase 5
text: Watched the movie last evening and honestly don't agree with or even see where the hate for the movie is coming from.I don't believe on critics. The movie is made for the audience, for us, not for the selected critics.Seems like majority of the audience loves the movie and my theater burst into applause after the movie.Quantumania is a huge, epic movie and a great start to Phase 5, a new dynasty.Kang is MENACING and you feel every bit of his power. The humor was handled perfectly in this movie and while they changed MODOK they did an amazing job with how they handled him.This movie is a solid 8.5/10 for me and has only increased my hype for the next two phases, especially for Loki 2.

title: Not mind blowing but generally fun
text: I think Marvel fans have been mostly affected by this past year with bad deliveries. This one is not bad. It's a good start for a new phase and we should give them a chance. The after credits are good. The story is not bad, the only think is i would've liked more tragedy in Ant-Man movies, something more intense or maybe less predictable. I missed Michael pena as well but generally the movie holds it's comedy side really good. Let's see how Loki 2 and the rest of the upcoming marvel features are for 2023. Kang has potential to be a great villain and i can't wait to see him interacting with other superheroes.

title: Not as bad as people say
text: I'll be honest. The dialogs are so cheesy. The antics are sometimes goofy. MODOK was a letdown. But the villain was great. Kang was powerful and had a clear purpose. The new characters were entertaining. The story itself is decent with good action sequences and visual effects. Also like the other 2 Ant-man movies, this movies is paramount to the continuity of MCU. Apart from Loki, this is the only MCU phase 4 project which actually contributes towards the next phase. It fit perfectly to Loki series. It even provides closure to the end of Janet life in quantum realm which was left unexplored in Ant-man and the wasp.

title: Definitely Worth A Watch, Despite Overwhelmingly Negative Reviews
text: A very entertaining film. Ant-Man is often seen as a lesser/less interesting character compared to some of the bigger superheroes in the Marvel domain, but Paul Rudd and the rest of the cast and the crew have certainly elevated his standing in my opinion. I wish I made the time to see it in the cinema.I enjoyed this film far more than 'Thor: Love and Thunder' (excuse the pun, but lighting didn't strike twice) and 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' (great, but it seemed that Chadwick's death had more to do with its popularity than the execution of the film - there, I said it). It is just as good as 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' and 'Guardians of the Galaxy: Volume 3'.This film was always up against it: post 'Avengers: End Game, a significant vehicle for establishing the main villain of the next phase of the MCU, a precursor for the next Avengers films, and no inclusion of/crossovers with other well known main Marvel characters during the feature film (must watch the post credits scene).It's visually spectacular, it's engaging, and it has a great ensemble cast. I wouldn't pay attention to the negative reviews.

title: my opinion
text: Many will not like it.. who are in a hurry to finish the story always.. this movie is for those who want to enjoy quietly and slowly.. like food when it is cooked slowly.. I really enjoyed the movie.. the movie was successful in my opinion because when the two hours ended, I was shocked how it went Quickly.. I did not pay attention to the time.. The photography and the visual effects were very, very excellent.. The presentation of the character of Al-Ghazi was awesome, especially the first scene after the ending song. Very excited about the new part of the Avengers. It deserves the 9 stars.. I was hoping The end will be sad.

The people who are giving it a bad rating they are crazy, they don't understand the movie., I don't know whether this movie will have high rating or low . But movie is awesome and fighting sequel and story is awesome .So, i give 10/10 . And everyone should watch this movie really awesome . Whoever watches this movie properly will understand that the movie is very good and will give it 10/10 . There is thrill in this movie too. So , support this movie . And watch it . I really enjoying this movie a lot. It will be more fun to see the post credits . Awesome movie üçøüé•

title: One of the better Marvel movies of late
text: Really enjoyed the movie. Was far far better than Love and Thunder and I enjoyed it more than Wakanda Forever. I'm quite surprised at the low scores, this was as good as the 2nd ant man, if you liked that and liked the first then you will enjoy this one as I did. The plot was sound, the GGI was fine but nothing compared to something like Shang-Chi. The characters are basically the same as in the other ant man movies, however Kang was an absolute standout here. One of the best villains so far in the MCU and this movie makes me incredibly excited to see where they take his character. Highly recommend.

title: 10 to help it, 7.5 actual
text: Listen, if you're a marvel fan, you'll love it. I think people went in expecting this to be an Avengers 4.5 the way ads have been portraying it (you're not in the wrong for expecting that) but this movie is its own thing. Was I expecting a big movie? Yes, but an Ant-Man big movie. Being a huge fan of the previous films, I knew I would love this film regardless as the director stayed the same. Even if it was the worst of the 3 (which I don't think it is) it still would be an enjoyable, fun ride. Do not listen to the critics, give this film a shot for yourself and I guarantee you will not be disappointed. Thank you.

title: I don't know what people wanted/expected
text: Quantumania is a good ol' fashioned Marvel Cinematic Universe over the top science fiction Superheroes action movie.I loved the new & old *Shrinkers*.I loved the Kangs.The action was incredibly thrilling &, at the same time, something all new to what we had seen in previous MCU movies.The plot was/is more than cohesive enough to frame all the action & visual extravaganza-ing. Marvel movies aren't going to win any Best Screen Play awards, but that isn't the point of the franchise. Marvel sets out to pack in all the super-action they can fit in a movie, while still providing enough story, plot, *reason* for it all.I don't know what there is to complain about, 'cept to just complain.

title: Star Wars meets Honey I Shrunk the Kids
text: Blue is the new Purple.Ant-Man Quantumania is one of the best sequels I have seen. It's definitely the best Ant-Man movie in the trilogy. And they owe the success all to Jonathan Majors aka Kang the Conqueror.Kang is the scariest Marvel villain I've seen. He's definitely scarier than the purple grape Thanos. It was all thanks to Major's commitment to the impenetrable character. His tortured to menacing facial expressions, bellowing voice and naturally imposing physique convinced me this was a super villain. No CGI needed.I literally saw the movie because of Majors, and I'm glad I did.For the rest of the cast, they did a stellar job too. The surprise MVP was Cassie. She had gumption, daring and humor like her dear dad. (And a gorgeous face, like a little Julianne Moore. That Lang/Van Dyne family is really ridiculously good-looking.) Michael Douglas was also surprisingly funny. Overall it was great to see the superhero family communicating and defending together.Ant-Man Quantumania will take you on a fantasy, philosophical journey, where you can both escape your life and contemplate it.I do look forward to seeing Kang disrupt other Avengers in coming sequels, and the classic Ant-Man franchise humor.P. S. The end credit scene kicks ass!P. S. S. Thank you R&CPMK for the advanced screening in ScreenX.

title: Excellent movie
text: Paul Rudd is in excellent form and they made sure not leave out the humor that he brings to these movies. Michelle Pfeiffer and Michael Douglas bring the drama needed to the film.You never got to see much of the Quantum world last time, but this movie brings it in to the light and displays some great imagination when it comes to the creatures and environment down there.Watch the end credit scenes both tie into later MCU movies coming out tin the future. One is at the very end.This is a family film so bring the kids some great stuff in the film from that perspective.The worst part of this movie was waiting for the movie to start. Nearly 30 minutes of ads ..etc absolutely terrible.

title: A psychedelic journey through the Quantum Realm
text: The third installment of Ant-Man takes the protagonist and company on a crazy journey through the Quantum Realm full of amazing dream scenes. As always with Marvel, the abundance of digital effects makes the film a visually stunning journey with settings, creatures, and characters reminiscent of the world of Star Wars or the wacky misadventures of Futurama. The group consisting of Paul Rudd, Evangeline Lilly, Michael Douglas, Michelle Pfeiffer and Kathryn Newton are a huge star for the film. The introduction of Kang after the Loki series is already a glimpse of what is to come in this phase 5 of the MCU, which is a very good start to start this next phase. Modok is quite a bizarre and cartoonish character, but he has a certain air of the original Modok. One detail that can be noted is that unlike the previous Ant-Man movies, there is a little less humor here and more seriousness. Even so, Scott Lang's humor continues to hold. This movie is a very good start to phase 5 and an amazing viewing experience that is endlessly entertaining. My final rating for this movie is 9/10.

title: Good start for phase 5
text: Strong start. Some people still expect every new marvel film to be like endgame, and this isn't it since that's not realistic. Recommend. It was fun to watch. I didn't watch any trailers over then the first one so there was a lot of surprises in the for me. It makes me excited for the next films to come out. The end credit seems were exciting and were like the other films were they were just joke ones. The characters were exciting and not boring. They were also some fun new characters which I hope to see again. It's a very good watch for the start of phase 5 and it's essential to see. Overall I love it!

title: Superb movie for marvel fans
text: "Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania" is a highly anticipated movie that promises to deliver an action-packed and entertaining experience for Marvel fans. With its impressive cast and talented director, the film is set to explore the Quantum Realm even further and introduce new characters and storylines.The film promises to continue the comedic and light-hearted tone of the previous "Ant-Man" movies, while also incorporating elements of science-fiction and adventure. Fans can expect to see their favorite characters return, as well as new additions to the Marvel Cinematic Universe.With Paul Rudd reprising his role as Ant-Man and the introduction of new characters like Kang the Conqueror, played by Jonathan Majors, the film is sure to be a thrilling ride from start to finish. Additionally, with Peyton Reed returning to direct the film, fans can be confident that the film will deliver on the expectations set by the previous installments.Overall, "Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania" is a must-see movie for Marvel fans and anyone looking for a fun and exciting adventure on the big screen.

title: Jesus so much Low raters.. why!?
text:
Theirs so much low ratings for this movie and it puzzles me why? I see alot of complaints about CGI & green screens & some complained its not creative & that its predictable n done before?? Lmao done before? Some harsh critics here.Some ppl yeesh.. its like they got a personal vendetta against the Top of the line CGI/Green screens lol. Make no mistake this not some cheap CGI you see in B-lister movies, the quality rivals Avatar #1 & Dr Strange #2 & even newer Star Wars films. Theirs a rich new world with highly creative life forms, plants, structures, as well as stunning futuristic looking settings that yes is CGI n green screen but how else would u make such a futuristic looking background? Would you prefer extras wear rubber suits to play the creatures seen in this film instead of CGI to make them look amazing like some comic book stuff?For the ones seriously whining & complaining this film doesnt connect to MCU in anyway n that its a standalone movie.. theirs tons of Marvel films that tell their own story but then has parts here & there to connect to the overall MCU, even the story of the villain lays the groundworks for future MCU movies. Its ridiculous that some people dont realize it connects lol. I mean how clear of a picture do you gotta draw for ppl to make them see it?The new Avengers movie coming out is called
"The Avengers : Kangs Dynasty", oh wait the villain in this Antman film is also Kang woww! Mindblowing stuff lol. It even explains & hints how his future role will be in the MCU, you gotta be very low intelligence to not put 2 & 2 together.Now the story could have been better but I felt they did an alright job to try & connect things to the marvel universe & set things up for the future to come. While yes alot of the movie might seem like its a standalone movie but what many clearly dont comprehend is this film has just opened the doors to a brand new universe filled with brand new life forms & tons of new settings in the Quantum Realms n can litterally spawn spinoffs just about the Quantum Realm ppl cuz of how richly diverse n new it is.Not to mention after the Loki Tv series, this is practically the next stage in story telling about Kang the Conqueror who is announced as the villain of the next avengers film... this whole Marvel Phase is about Kang ppl. So everything you see & learn about him in this film is extremely insightful going forward.I really hate when people rate movies by comparing them to others. Some rate it lowly cuz they compared to other marvel or sci fi movies, when you should be just judging the film with fresh eyes and not comparing it to any others or else u are just giving an unfair n bias rating.Lastly for the ppl who tried to say this movie isnt creative.. that its been done before.. I challenge u to find everyone another movie that talks about a Quantum Realm & showing the life forms that exist in it thats ruled by an Evil Multiversal travelling Conqueror lmao.

title: Kang will return
text: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is a phenomenal film that manages to deliver an incredible cinematic experience with its stunning visual effects, engaging storyline, and exceptional performances. Directed by Peyton Reed, the movie has certainly lived up to its predecessor, with even more action, humor, and heart.One of the highlights of this movie is the impressive VFX, which truly immerses the audience in a world of shrinking and growing superheroes. The sequences involving the Quantum Realm are breathtaking, and the action scenes are expertly choreographed and executed. The visuals are top-notch, and the use of 3D enhances the experience even further.The storyline is equally impressive, with a perfect blend of humor and emotion. The movie takes the audience on a thrilling ride through time and space, with a creative and well-crafted script that keeps the viewers engaged throughout. The pacing of the film is just right, allowing for enough character development and action to keep the audience invested in the story.The performances in the film are also exceptional. Paul Rudd as Scott Lang/Ant-Man and Evangeline Lily as Hope Van Dyne/Wasp have a great on-screen chemistry, and their comedic timing is spot on. Michael Douglas and Michelle Pfeiffer as Hank Pym and Janet Van Dyne respectively bring gravitas to their roles, adding depth to the story. Jonathan Majors as the new Marvel villain Kang the Conqueror is truly mind-blowing, bringing an intense and intimidating presence to the screen.Overall, Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is a must-see film for Marvel fans and casual moviegoers alike. It is an excellent example of what can be achieved with creative storytelling, innovative visual effects, and exceptional performances. Peyton Reed has done an amazing job with this movie, and it is sure to leave audiences eagerly anticipating the next installment in the Ant-Man franchise.

title: What on earth are the critics watching?
text: This movie is absolutely fantastic, with everything you'd want in a comic book adaption. Great cast, funny dialogue, heartbreaking dialogue, and a villain whom you can't help but feel hopeless against. At this point, people are just criticizing for just about no reason. Is it perfect? No. The Godfather is perfect. But, this movie is fun, sets up the future perfectly, and leaves you anticipating the future of its universe. Also has two of the best post credit scenes in any MCU film to date. Jonathan Majors is going to be a force in these films, and I for one can't wait to see his Kang take on the rest of the superheroes!

title: Lots of fun, great start for next phase
text: I'm not sure what everybody was complaining about. I avoided the spoilers and bought the movie. Watched it last night on Amazon Prime. It was a lot of fun, and a great introduction to the MCU phase. I'm glad Marvel is leaning into thier weird side because seeing MODOK was awesome. Yes, there's a ton of CGI, yes, the storyline seems somewhat different from the comics. But overall the movie did a good job with these completely oddball list of characters. Anyways looking forward to seeing more in the next phase of shows and movies. I've said this before: Based on on some of the critics reviews it seems the dislike of hate is forced. I have zero regrets buying this and enjoying it at home and will absolutely watch it again.

title: Jonathan Majors Conquerors
text: Jonathan Majors (Kang) was the best highlight of movie, he overshadows everything when he is on screen. We can see the potential. As an AntMan movie this is good and starts the Phase 5 in a good way. Story wasn't really impressive except Janet and Kang's relation. In first half story was running in slow pace but that was good but the second half should have been like that, but it runs faster than the first half. Camera work is not as good as the previous two movies but it has some serious stuff in it. Overall I loved the movie and is enjoyable and I can say that Marvel is really back in the game.

title: Extraordinary movie
text: This is a quality film. It is (as every movie with Paul Rudd should be) hilarious, but more than that it brings together so many pieces of the Marvel universe like the quantum realm and the multiverse, and crafts them together so beautifully. Jonathan Majors as Kang the Conqueror is stellar, and I am excited to see him (in many different costumes) in future Marvel films. Additionally, Paul Rudd, Evangeline Lilly, and all of the supporting cast are amazing as well. Overall one of the best movie i have seen in many tear. Nice direction, nice music, nice acting. It was fun to watch with friends and family.

title: DO NOT LISTEN TO THE CRITICS!!!
text: Ok, look i have never reviewed a movie on imdb but when i see the insane amount of negative reviews i just had to. This has to be one of my favorite marvel movies of all time. I went to see it expecting dissapointment due to the amount of negative reviews it has. But man was i blown away by how fun this movie was. From the very start i was engaged and sat in suspense at what is coming next. The locations during this movie looked very good. Jonathan Majors acting is incredible and terrifying, and him playing Kang was just meant to be. Kang is my new favorite villain and my favorite character of the MCU alongside Loki. Yes, it has some plotholes but EVERY marvel movie does, and for me it made sense to the extent where i can see where phase 5/6 is going. It seems like people have forgotten what a good marvel movie looks like.I can't say this enough GO SEE IT! Because i promise you, you won't regret it.PS. Make sure to see both post credit scenes as they are in my top post credit scenes of all time!!

title: Enjoyable for all ages
text: A feast for the lovers of fantasy. I am so delighted they make films like that which are so imaginative and fun! Michelle Pfeiffer is such a beautiful woman at her age and it was nice to watch her play a major role in this film.The film is underrated. It has a few scenes which are similar to scenes from Star Wars which is also a good thing, as who doesn't like Star Wars?You do have to be a fan of fantasy to enjoy watching this kind of films though. And of course it is more suitable for those who are young at heart regardless of their age.In summary I appreciate marvel studios for presenting decent films to the viewers.

title: Overhated but I loved it
text: This movie was fun and great. Characters I love like ant man,wasp, and hank pym and new characters like M. O. D. O. K and the dude with the yellow blasters thingy for a head and Kang omg he is a amazing villian and I can't wait to see him in the future of the mcu. I liked the how ant man and the end of the movie was thinking like is the dude I just fought is he really dead but he carries on with it like nothing happen. It sucked that M. O. D. O. K died but he had a cool arc and it was cool to see Darren again and how he turned and how Kang saved him. The only thing I didn't like was how Bill Murray character was served though.

title: Don't listen to the haters
text: This was a fantastic entry into the next MCU phase. Jonathan Majors plays a phenomenal Kang- despite whatever legal troubles he's enmeshed in, and whether he's innocent or guilty - the rage and betrayal and hurt and menace that he puts into this character, it's difficult to picture any other known actor doing such a job. I've known folks to complain about the story and the CGI here. But they need to stop comparing every new MCU product to Endgame and Infinity War. This is an overall excellent entry into the Kang story arc for anyone willing to give it an honest shake.Can't wait to see how the rest of the arc plays out.

title: Childhood imagination coming true
text: It is a movie in which, at the age of 52, I found exactly what my imagination was able to create while reading books since my childhool. In the 70s, it was predicted to me that in the present time we would fly with cars and our homes would be more like those of the Jetsons. Well, all that, didn't come to pass.But this movie fulfilled at least one of my wishes: the colors and strangest ideas that the imagination is capable of creating, whether creatures, spaceships, worlds, visually beautifully illustrated.No, I refuse to question everything about logic in this film, because seeing an injured spaceship in the background being comforted by another spaceship in the final battle: my boundless imagination would have made leaps of joy if I had seen something like that in movies back in the 70s.I usually get upset about excessive use of blue screens, but presumably that wasn't the problem for me, but rather just what it is used for.

title: An Awesome Film and one of the Best 3rd movies of Marsdvel Hero
text: Ant-Man and Wasp: Quantimania is easily one Marvel's Top 7 films. While switching between humor and seriousness, it managed to never get boring and had me chuckling at random interactions the whole way through. It feels like a mix between the first Guardians of the Galaxy and Thor Ragnarok in both humor and a diversity(in personalities and groups) with a strong Star Wars influence.Do all of the characters get their time to shine? No, but I'm sure we will see many of them again which is good enough for me. The world is great, the characters are great, and the villain is a mysterious and interesting as Thanos. Luckily I'm sure we'll see his other personas before the character is completely removed from the cinematic time line. Honestly it could almost be a stand alone Sci Fi if it wanted to be.

title: Much better than I expected
text: I think many of the negative reviews are just people jumping on the bandwagon. I really enjoyed the movie. They didn't make the hero too stupid as they have been doing lately. (Thor, Shazam)The introduction of his daughter to the show was a nice move. I suspected ants would play a role in the movie but I didn't know how. So that was a complete surprise. I did catch an attitude about the one political comment. It was too bad but I caught it. They can leave that stuff out of the movies. Less woke and more just good old fashion fun and adventure.I recommend the movie and I will watch it again.

title: Good escapism fun
text: I know it's not the thing to like this but I did. If you sit back and enjoy the world created here and try not to over analyse everything you may find it good entertainment. Can't help feeling that this could have been a GOTG outing with Groot and the talking broccoli teaming up ! Paul Rudd is great as ever Jonathan Majors is genuinely menacing so it will be interesting to see if the recent issues with his personal life will be dealt with. Michelle Pfeiffer is still great and looking fabulous and what's not to like about Michael Douglas. Yes I know it's all green screen but taken as entertainment it's pretty good.

title: Out Of This World... Literally!
text: The third installment of Ant-Man series is still playing with quantum physics. But the result is out of this world! Like, literally. It's made a whole new world, just like in Star Wars. I feel like it should've been made into a series instead a movie. It could've explained a bunch of crazy stuff that's going on in this movie. But don't worry, this movie is still good. Honestly, I think it's amazing. I just can't believe this story came from Ant-Man, the most underestimated Avenger ever. The post credit scene is saying that there will be another movie with Ant-Man and the Wasp. I'm looking forward to it. Especially with the new enemy.

title: Best of the 3 ant-man movies
text: The first 2 movies from ant-man where good but this one is the best. I love al the CGI and effects, they are really great and very wel done.The introduction of the new enemy of the next MCU phase was extremely wel done and intriguing. Especially the very end of the movie keeps me wanting more of this stuf.I hope that the next movies with this great enemy keeps on giving like this movie has done. I really want to see where this is going to.The battles where nice to look at with some good fights and stuf. Hope the next movie wil be on the same elan as this one and give some more crazy action.

title: If you want to know
text: It's the lead up movie to the next big avenger movies. The role of Kang was done phenomenal, And I can't wait for him to do more movies in that role.Now I will say it felt like the movie went by a little fast. But I can't hate on that, I didn't feel like it dragged on for hours, and to where I felt like I had to force myself to watch it at any point. Maybe I'm just a big fan of marvel movies, but I can be honest when they make bad movies/tv shows like she hulk ain't nobody want that,If I wanted to see and character be like Deadpool I'll watch Deadpool. He breaks the 4th wall in the best way, But further more if you haven't watch it yet give it a shot you want regret it!

title: Highly Enjoyable,Creative and Well Acted!
text:
I wasnt sure what to expect here..Was this going to be yet another Disneyfied,watered down silly campy mess or perhaps something different? Well this one really surprised me with a perfect blend of light humor sparsely mixed into what was a rather serious toned, even intense at times storyline..
Paul Rudd was able to show his dynamic range here playing it funny initially but taking serious to the max when threatened by Kang.. Majors did an Outstanding job with Kang"s character,
whether it was the subtle facial mannerisms or the downright stone cold shift in tone from friendly to someone who would crush the universe and think nothing of it..The guy Made this movie..His performances stood out and elevated the storyline into a seriously awesome one...I only hope future appearances of the Kang character are as intense and terrifying and well acted as he was in this movie...The scenery was incredible to watch and extremely creative in design ...This is a very good scfi adventure,if you like a little humor very lightly mixed into an eye popping ride that is dark,intense and thrilling at times...This is Not another gooey mess like the recent Thor movie... Its a solid, well written and better still acted ,quality scfi..thumbs up!

title: pretty good-ish maybe
text: This movie somehow managed to be exactly the same like Rings of power but on the same time the complete opposite. How ?It's a very big 200 million budget movie same as ROP but for some reason opposite of ROP in that the world and graphics feels cheap and lazily made while having pretty solid cast and with acting performance.Good acting actors good directing good story but all wasted in mediocre mundane world.Maybe if the movie was not released on the same year as avatar it might had better reviews and rating but it did notthe movie is basically a cheap imitation of star wars and avatar and avenger combined which is not a bad thing if done right unfortunately it is not the case for the ant man.

title: Haters just don't get it
text: All the haters leaving negative reviews stating weak story just don't get it. This movie was a part of opening up the multiverse saga and brings in story lines from the comics surrounding Kang the Conqueror, and shows how much of a threat the avengers will be facing soon. If one Kang is that powerful, imagine fighting hundreds or thousands of Kangs just as powerful. This movie was a stepping stone for the greater MCU future and the haters are giving bad reviews based on their own inability to understand the intricacies of the multiverse and how the quantum realm connects to it.This film was great, classic ant-man humour but with higher stakes than the two previous instalments, and offers insight to this sagas main villain.For those haters that dislike the focus on female superheroes that the MCU is taking, so what? It's time to wake up and put away your biases. Superheroes are superheroes male or female, gender of characters should not affect your enjoyment of the film. These characters exist within the comics and have for years, Marvel is simply drawing from the source material. And while yes the MCU is introducing many more female superheroes from the comics this saga than they did in the infinity saga, they are still introducing more male heroes and heroes from different cultures, creating a much more diverse team of avengers, as well they should be.

title: Don't believe the HATE
text: This movie was really fun! I don't understand why it was picked apart by critics, but then again they lived Banshees of Ishirin and that movie was horrible and nothing!Not the best dialogue and it had cheesy moments, but fun story, and KANG was phenomenal! The action was good and the actors did their part, but lest be honest, this movie was made to introduce Kang and it did that very well.Some of the side characters were really cool and funny, but not super memorable. The world at times even had a Star Wars feel to it, and I thought that was cool.I recommend you go see it on the big screen and don't let the critics (who often are out of touch) sway you from a good time!

title: Great Movie
text: Great movie. Overall it left me with hope for the future of the MCU. Could have had better cgi but I get that some of the funds for this movie had to be used on black panther to reshoot half of it since Chadwick Boseman passed. M. O. D. O. K could have been done better. He face sort of looked flat. They could have just made it look like a normal head but disproportionate to everything else. I loved the concept of the movie and all of the different new creatures and worlds. The only thing I didn't really like and this is the main reason I'm giving it a nine instead of a ten is that it did have some similarities to Star Wars. Its not Star Wars! Disney. Star Wars and marvel are not meant to be mixed so don't start stealing ideas from that or any of your Disney movies! Other than that though it was great.

title: Ahhhh, that's better a marvel movie that felt like Marvel
text: Brilliant, finally a movie that starts pulling together the confusing threads that have been laid over the past 8 years.Just the right level of humour, action, character building. All in all, loved it.The big bad was developed so much better than Gor the God butcherer. It wasn't all over the place like Multiverse of madness and it wasn't one long bad joke like Love and Thunder.It felt like a marvel movie should be after so many years of being starved of them. Loved all the characters, loved the plot, loved the action, loved the clever references to other productions. YES!! Feel like my excitement for the MCU has been rekindled!

title: The best Ant-Man movie?
text: I disliked the first one as it was a mess. It was so badly cut that it was a mess to follow. Second one was really good with an amazing villain. This was my main initial issue with this movie at first. Marvel had maybe their best female villain ever in Ant-Man 2. She was spectacular all the way and delivered a spotless performance. How often do we get a truly great female villain? The bad guy in this one was quite transparent as it's a film for kids so right away I knew who the bad guy was and was let down. They went away from what made Ant-Man 2 so great. She carried the movie on her shoulders. And this one is a more typical and predictable storyline.But this one is actually not bad at all. They of course are now exploring multiuniverses as the main Earth is too overprotected with way too many strong heroes. So most new Marvel movies are set in some alternative universe and often this fails horribly as we don't get to follow known characters in their own world. But I actually like what they did here as all the jokes land and we get to explore a new Star Wars like world. I was very, very surpriced about how well the humor worked. Thor 4 showed how awful these Marvel movies can turn out if they overdo the humor and think they are funny. It was horrible. Unfunny and didn't take itself seriously so I didn't either. Ant-Man 3 has natural jokes that are not overdone and all land as they are subdued. Often just small quirps not gigantic CGI gags. The CGI meanwhile is used for serious action.I do feel like the movie is a bit too frantic. We meet too many new characters and the universe is never fully explored. Many side characters only get a few scenes. And as the daughter is now also a superhero as seen on the poster we get way too many superpowers. This is why Michael Douglas was so nice here. Just the normal smart guy in a crazy world. The daughter should have had this role. Just make her a normal young girl kicking butt when needed by being brave instead of making her part of the crew. It would make this universe more magical as we could see it through the eyes or a regular girl from a regular world. Instead the movie becomes too busy. But frankly it's never dull and so many things make so much sense. All plot elements and characters are perfectly put together in a coherent mess. And once the bad guy is defeated it finally dawns on me how this all works out. The movie is so clever if you just think about the smaller elements and how the time travel works. Frankly Marvel is not dead at all. I know they have made a ton of horrible stuff after Avengers: Infinity War (2018), but there are still decent Marvel movies being made if you just look for them. The Spider-Man series for example is still going fairly strong. It's not the old Marvel with top quality everywhere. But there is still some fun to be found in this franchise. In 2021 and 2022 we got 7 Marvel movies. 4 were absolutely ghastly. But now in 2023 we start out very strong so hopefully the last 2 years can be washed away.

title: Amazing
text: I really shouldn't trust those rankings anymore. I watched this movie and it was great and funny. While the score of the movie is 6.1 !!The very boring and stupid movie " guardians of the galaxy" with those stupid creatures and talking animals Ranked higher than 8 but this one ranked around 6.This is more exciting than that stupid movie "guardian of the galaxy"!! I really wonder who vote for the rate of the movies ! Maybe children ! Because only children can enjoy watching talking animals .Actually i don't have anything else to say but i need to continue because my review needs to contain at least 600 characters and i don't know why!!!

title: Quantawesomeness
text: I honestly don't understand the complaints about this movie. I mean this movie explores the quantum universe like anything I've ever seen. It really puts things into perspective on the amazement of worlds that seem to be infinitely smaller than our own. The Cgi is spectacular, the creatures amazing, the vehicles look awe inspiring as well. I kept seeing the previews to this movie and not even the trailers were disappointing unlike so many I've seen before for countless other movies. I find the sequels to each Marvel character seem to get better. Thor's are a bit of a roller coaster and I'm not really sure about the Hulk's. Like i said, wonderful cgi exploration, great character development.

title: old superhero feeling
text:
I don't know why I'm not a big ant man fan but this movie was different it reminded me of 2000 superhero movie that , it was good and there is nothing i can say to make your decision better you have to watch it yourself
i just really like that they added an extra element to this with many possibilities .I don't know why I'm not a big ant man fan but this movie was different it reminded me of 2000 superhero movie that , it was good and there is nothing i can say to make your decision better you have to watch it yourself
i just really like that they added an extra element to this with many possibilities.

title: Phase Five Is Off With A Bang
text: A more traditional super-hero epic, wrapped up in gorgeous quantum sparks and heavy Star Wars vibes (Anyone else feel like we were in a galaxy far far away at times?! Cantina's and creatures galore. Loved it!).Visually wild with a striking score and a terrifying villain. Performances were spot on from all the cast, but Major's was absolutely magnificent.Whilst being absolutely bonkers inside the quantum realm, the story is a lot more straight forward than previous MCU entries.Killer introduction for Kang. Continued fun times for the Ant-Man series. Phase Five is officially kicked off with a bang!

title: Fun - but don't think too hard
text: I enjoyed the heck out of this - nice to see Kang properly in the MCU, but I did have some issues with the internal consistency of Ant Man going bigger and smaller than quantum's scale... he's a slow lumbering thing when he's large but *still subatomic*. That kind of works if the quantum world is faster than our world, but not otherwise.I did miss Luis, but he wouldn't have fitted in to this one. The mirroring of Scott's narration was a really nice touch beginning and end.The thing Marvel will have to take care with in Kang is that keeping his narrative coherent for the lay-audience will be very tricky indeed. "Didn't they kill him, why are there two of them?" I can imagine future films having characters asking dumb questions just so they can be explained to....Nice to see Kamala in the titles :)

title: In think it's really good. Plz watch the movie and don't judge the movie on ratings, coz this was extremley comic based one‚ù§ i love it‚ù§‚ù§
text: Antman gave a good start to Phase 5& the Wasp Quantumania reviews are one example of not watching movies after being dependent.Especially, those who ask if they need to read comics to understand movies are confused. But for Marvel comic fans, this is a good movie for Kang.Not many cringe jokes like love & thunder have been added, Action & Storyline is quite good. Because the storyline of this is not completely finished, it will continue for another movie... If you don't have a good knowledge about the comic background, you won't be able to imagine who lost in the end.Visuals & Cinematography: Superb & Beautiful (Vfx artists should be seriously appreciated for the effort they put into this. Some scenes reminded me of the first movie Doctor Strange) It doesn't matter if you haven't watched this in 3D.Cgi: Good (Wakanda Forever has normal level. Talking about the characters, all the characters have been treated very well. Except MODOK.MODOK's origin and first appearance are badass. Even though it's pretty badass with the Face Shield/Armor, it's confusing when you show your face. But as said before, there is almost no movie that has successfully shown a giant floating head. So the look doesn't matter.But the character who has given some cringe dialogues from the middle is a mess.Kang is given an origin quite different from the comics and suitable for the MCU. Jonathan Majors was killing it. As I have been saying since the day Jonathan was cast, there is hardly anyone better than Jonathan as Kang. This Kang is an emotionally driven character. Seeing the expressions on Jonathan's face that he is a kang variant who is patient enough and can't bear it, the way he fights is professional.FeelIt is noticeable that he is like a boxer. Perhaps Jonathan may have used the experience he gained from Creed 3 for this one as well. The best thing about the movie is Jonathan Majors.And this is only one variant. We still haven't seen a dangerous Kang. Because like I said before, this is forwardA story that has to be continued... If you haven't seen the two Credits Scenes, you won't be able to imagine anything. If you don't understand, I'll watch all the videos about kang.) Credit damn Accurate to that scenefrom comicsChassy is fine. Because the character has been built beautifully as a person who is still learning to be a hero and is not amused by stories like I'm better than previous hulk/thor.Hank Pym My gosh, finally we saw him as he wasshould be. Although it was quite disappointing that Hank was not the age of iron man like Hank in the comics, but an old man, we get to see the badass Hank Pym like in the comics. And Janet & other characters are also okay.This story, which gives a good start to Secret Wars and Kang Dynasty, does not end here. So it can be said that the story has been done beautifully. Ratings don't matter. The movie is a perfect start to the Multiverse saga. Btw, don't make fun of the movie by commenting and spoiling it in the comments...

title: Packed in Action, great fun
text: I have liked all 3 Ant-man movies, especially the mix of their tone between comedy and action and this one doesn't dissapoint. Even though I missed greatly Michael Pe√±a and his comedy.Ant-man almost since the very first minute starts with action and never stops, the involvement of the family with his daughter Cassie plus the characters we already know is a fun additionm and shows more purpose to Scott Lang.Kudos to Jonathan Majors and how he plays Kang. Now I start to understand why he is the new "big baddy" for Marvel. He plays an interesting and powerful villian, he is not fully developed but since he seems to be more present in the future I guess they have a plan for that. Can't wait to see whats next.

title: Movie was Great üòä
text: So many people don't seem to know the chaos that Jonathan Majors Character will cause in future Marvel movies, but I'm finally excited. To be honest after endgame some people seem to lose interest in Marvel movies because of the new characters but this movie was exciting because it will link and renew many of the characters at the end of the Phase. If you are a Marvel fan you will enjoy this movie just because of the new BAD. I think Jonathan Majors did great and I am very excited to see him in future Marvel Movies. Don't let bad reviews or on the fence reviews make you not see this movie. In my opinion it's a must watch if you would like to understand the direction of Marvel. The visual is awesome and as you know it's Ant Man Movie so there will be laughs, it's fun, but Majors really caught my eye.

title: Not a bad start to phase 5
text: Wow!! Ok so this was a pretty good entry into the MCU. I know the critics on RT hit it hard and I'm sure some fans will feel the same. But considering how Phase 4 landed I actually found this movie to be a breath of fresh air. It's very much like a Sci-fi movie and very different than many MCU movies but I didn't mind that at all. It does feel like a combination of other sci-fi films like Star Wars, again not a problem for me personally.It was a little goofy at times but that's the comedy you usually see in a Marvel Film. I enjoyed that it didn't push a lot of politics into it and Jonathan Majors was an awesome villain. There were some scenes not big scenes that they could of left out. A character or two didn't seem needed in my opinion but all major characters were very cool. To be honest it felt more like a Kang movie but that was awesome because I enjoy the villains.There are two end credit scenes both are cool, a lot of people made a big fuss about them but it wasn't anything I didn't expect to see. There is a lot going on in this movie but if you watched all the Marvel movies it's not that hard to keep up. We watched it in 3-D and that's the way to go in my opinion. On a scale on 1-10 I think a 7.5-8 is a fair score. But overall I really enjoyed the crap out of this film. And I know people are going to say I'm a Marvel fanboy but I still haven't watched Thor Love & Thunder a second time. This was easily the best Ant-Man film. This movie will get multiple watches from me.

title: Awesome fun!!
text: Love these ant man movies. They have the best cast for this especially the main. He's perfect for this role. Lots of humor as always, this one doesn't have Michael Pe√±a, but that is because he never made it into the quantum realm yet, so he was missed. Especially his way of explaining stuff. CGI is top notch and all the different creative imaginative creatures are just stunning. Someone went to a LOT of detail here. Some are just plain weird. Bill Murray in it is a great addition too. Plot is awesome and quite possibly this new villain is far more dangerous than Thanos ever was!!! He's quite a viscous villain more so than Thanos. So they've set the universe up to deal with this new multiverse threat which is great. Fits with all the marvel stuff so far perfectly, enjoy with whole family, nothing questionable in it at all , a few cuss words and a lot of great fights that's about all there. Enjoy!!! I will watch this again. Soon. üòä

title: Paul Rudd Never Disappoints!
text: I've been quite excited for this one for quite a while now, the hype was built over such a long period of time, especially for comic book fans. Paul Rudd is back at it again as our favourite witty geek Scott Lang. Only this time Ant-Man and the Wasp find themselves exploring the Quantum Realm, interacting with strange new creatures and embarking on an adventure that pushes them beyond the limits of what they thought was possible, honestly it's insane!Enter Kang The Conquerer! The reason the hype has been so immense is this man's appearance that we have longed for for many years. Played by the amazing Jonathan Majors and boy did he deliver an amazing and rememorable performance, he's everything I expected Kang to be, I loved it!Highly Recommend, definitely one of the stronger titles in the MCU.

title: Part of my MCU top 5
text: Firstly, I can't get the hate around this movie. This is the PERFECT beginning for Phase 5. I absolutely loved this movie, with it's bad CGI in some places, with some bad dialogue, with some obvious plot holes... But, man, this was good.Would you love it if you're not an MCU fan? No, probably not. Would you love it if you're a crazy MCU fan? No, probably not. But if you go in expecting to see some great visuals and a compelling story, yes, you'll love it.Kudos to Jonathan Majors for the amazing performance, congrats to Rudd, Lilly, Pfeiffer and Douglas (not you, Cassie Lang, you were meh) for amazing portrayals.Looking forward to phase 5 after seeing this!

title: Quantumaniac
text: Believe me when I say I actually like Ant-Man and the Wasp Quantumania. It was the first Marvel movie I saw in theaters and was satisfied with it when it was over. I like the typical Ant-Man humor in it. For me, it's supposed to be an Ant-Man movie, so it's supposed to have jokes and not always make sense. I find the humor in the Ant-Man movies good, and it's definitely better than the humor in Thor Love and Thunder. I like how this movie covers the Quantum Realm in detail. It was just a mysterious place that is smaller than atoms in the first two Ant-Man movies, and was a plot device for time travel in Endgame, but in this movie, we finally get to actually see it in detail.I find the CGI alright, of which my opinion is better than other people. I find MODOK is done right. I find it where MODOK is not possible to do in live action without looking somewhere on the uncanny spectrum. He's either creepy or weird and can't really be anything else while remaining comic accurate. People like comic accurate but MODOK is a character people might hate on either way (not comic accurate, complain about being not comic accurate. Comic accurate, complain about looking weird or creepy).I also find it does an alright job setting up the Multiverse. It has Kang the Conqueror, of whom in known to be the Multiversal threat throughout the Marvel multiverse. It is definitely a film that would help build up to the whole multiverse in the MCU'S future (even if it bombed, it helps show what to try to stay away from).Overall, it's by third favorite comic book film of 2023.

title: A Fun Joyride of a Movie
text: I'm a bit late to the party after having been put off by the reviews received for this movie.This is a fun, joyride of a movie...a bit of Marvel with a Star Wars feel to it. The actors give convincing performances and there is a glint in their eyes knowing this is a throwback to old fashioned sci-fi action movies and tv shows such as Sinbad, Lost in Space, Land of the Giants, Captain Nemo and Jules Verne type genres done with a modern cgi feel. I felt, previously, that the 2nd Ant-Man movie had a disappointing low budget vibe but this was bigger in scale, literally. It set up a menacing villain played by the infamous Jonathan Majors. Even with his real life anti-social issues, it would not be difficult to recast him as he has multiple images throughout the movie and Marvel Universe. I don't think much for Kang's chances, though, against the Avengers if he can be thwarted by the diminutive Ant-Man team.

title: MUCH BETTER THAN I EXPECTED
text: I went into the theater with low expectations due to Marvel's blunders and wokeness in Phase 4. I was came away surprised and pleased with the story and the visuals. The movie is NOT woke, not in the least. No f-words either.Very nice emphasis was placed on FAMILY and we need more of that.The colorful and intricate visuals seemed to outshine Avatar and the large pallette of different and freaky characters in this sub-atomic universe made for a visual feast. Better than Star Wars!Great action and great acting with all of the main actors getting equal time to shine. At least two plot twists. One or two of the jokes were cringe and there was one instance of TMI of a personal type.A very good starter to Phase 5 and a good set up for what is to come. It was an adventure, a bizarre road trip of sorts.

title: An entertaining watch
text: It's an entertaining watch and I left the showing in a good mood, so that's a win for me. Jonathan Mayors portrayal of Kang stole the movie so I'm excited for Phase 5. Of course, there are some things are were a bit meh but it didn't impact the movie in a mayor way. An ok movie.The length of the movie was perfect, not too long, not too short. Overall it was a fun movie, I don't know why everyone expects an Oscar-worthy movie everytime the MCU debuts a new movie, they know their audience.The CGI was good, not great but good. A step up from THOR: Love and Thunder, FOR SURE.The comedy wasn't overdone thankfully, there were some missteps and bad timing but it was bearable.

title: The beginning of Phase 5 was so impressive!
text: Spoiler Free: I got goosebumps and for me that means the movie was a success. Frankly speaking, expectations were a little too high and those who watch the film will understand what is at stake. However, I am ready to give 100 out of 10 to Jonathan Majors for his game! His tears in his eyes throughout the scenes amazed me. This is really a very, very good villain for Marvel. And I'm sure that despite all the action in this film, in the future, this character will have a much more reverent and intriguing motivation than Thanos. I personally liked Kathryn Newton, the motivation is written quite well for a teenager, and in general, I hope the potential of the character will be well revealed in future projects. Not 10 out of 10 for sure. But the beginning of Phase 5 looks quite impressive!

title: Very interesting concept, getting trapped in the Quantum world.
text: These Ant-Man movies started in 2015 with Paul Rudd starring as Ant-Man. The concept was a scientist (Michael Douglas) had developed a technique to shrink the size between atoms some 25 years earlier but shelved it, and in fact denied it, because his prot√©g√© has evil intentions for it, making the world a more dangerous place.Then that was followed up with the 2018 "Ant-Man and The Wasp" where together Ant-Man and Wasp must protect the secrets of the shrinking technology.Now we have this one, 2023 "Quantumania" and, as the title suggests the whole family, including Ant-Man's daughter, get sucked into the Quantum Realm when an experiment goes awry. Once they are there they first have to figure out how to survive, how to fight the evil man who can bring all parallel universes together for evil purposes, then get back to their own reality.Being a Scientist myself this type of fictional story is naturally appealing to me. I enjoyed it as not-too-serious, good fun. My wife started with me but only was able to last half-way, probably from playing golf in the hot weather earlier. Our high today was 103.At home, on DVD from our public library.

title: Remember Comicbooks
text: At first, filming the whole time in the multiverse offers a lot possibilities for a story. It isn't a contra point. I liked the latest Dr. Strange for this reason. And I think for Marvel it's just the fantasy of former stories we liked. So it's in the line of Marvel. It's the comic book fantasy we found in history in books or comics of Marvel. Don't we? Don't make any borders for fantasy. But stay in touch with the characters!!! For this part, I do not like every figure especially the wasp in person Evangeline Lilly. I think as the partner of antman there should be more emotions. I'am looking forward. And I hope the best.

title: manages to provide some enjoyment even if it's not great
text: Under-the-radar Avenger Scott Lang is making the most of his life with Hope van Dyne and his teenaged, scientifically-inclined daughter Cassie who's budding interest has led her to study the Quantum Realm. Unfortunately Cassie's curiosity leads to a big snafu that pulls her, Scott, Hope, along with Janet van Dyne and Hank Pym into the strange, dark Quantum depths faced with an adversary they can't possibly hope to defeat. It doesn't take very long to figure out that this third Ant-Man film is looking to raise the stakes and spectacle with big, broad action scenes and incandescent visual effects, but to put it bluntly it's easy to see that much of the inspiration came from the Star Wars franchise. The jokes don't always land, the callbacks are expected, and it piles on too much sentiment in its latter stages, but there's a good collection of characters that are actually worth caring about, the villain is a formidable one, and it's able to create some anticipation for Phase Five. Is it in the upper echelon or the be-all end-all MCU film? No, but it provides quite a bit of fun in its own way. ***

title: One Time Watch
text: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania serves as a one-time watch that marks the introduction of Phase 5 of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Although it may not be on the same level as blockbuster hits like Avengers: Endgame, the film is still worth watching for Marvel fans who want to keep up with the ongoing storylines and events within the MCU.The film provides an entertaining and fun-filled experience for viewers with its unique mix of action, humor, and science fiction. The chemistry between the lead actors, Paul Rudd and Evangeline Lilly, is one of the highlights of the film, and the addition of new characters like Kang the Conqueror adds to the excitement.However, while the film is enjoyable and provides some thrilling moments, it may not be the best of the Marvel films. The plotline can be predictable, and some of the action sequences may feel repetitive for viewers who have already seen the previous films in the series.Overall, Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is a good film, but it may not be the best of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. It's a one-time watch that provides an entertaining experience and serves as an introduction to the next phase of the Marvel Universe.

title: Absolute decline of a universe that is far from being what it was
text: In direct line with the decline of Marvel since End Game.To think that the first Ant Man movie had been a pleasant surprise and, although the second had been average to a fault, this third part exceeds expectations (for the worse).We can approach from many places because he is terrible.From performances, implausible script, the presentation of a bad guy like Kang who instead of being scary ends up being defeated because that's how it was written.We are introduced to a Cassie Lang who has no charisma, a Michael Douglas and Michelle Pfeiffer who are just collecting a check and nothing more. Even Paul Rudd who is always good fails in his performance. Cameo by Bill Murray is forgettable and I could continue describing for parts.At the special effects level it is also a disaster. The problems that Marvel has presented in these years at that level are well known, but here they were overcome, once again, for the worse. Look at what MODOK is, see what the quantum realm looks like, the facial rejuvenation and an endless number of failures that put this movie in the top 3 or top 5 of worst MCU projects in 15 years.As with The Marvels, She Hulk, Echo or Secret Invasion, Marvel has to change, if it doesn't it is destined for a failure of biblical proportions...

title: doesn't understand itself
text: Personally I loved ant-man 1 and 2, they were comedic, fun, exciting and lightning in a bottle, Quantumania isn't any of those things. This is a fine movie, and before phases 1 through 3 upped our standard for super hero movies this would have been quite an entertaining thing to see, and I definitely still like it. The problem for me is this film gave up the zany and unique high-jinks adventures of the two previous entries for a far more serious mood and a far more traditional superhero theme. Possibly they were trying to make up for the lack of captain america or iron man to hit those notes for this phase but ant-man works better as comic relief. I would also have liked to see more of the quantum realm, a mini-series would be nice, there is potential there and I know the comics have done stuff there. I hope the next ant-man picks returns to the style and quality of the first two films. Still very watchable though.
